modName: Crafting Doesn't Grant XP -- Uncapper preset
summary: Custom .ini for the Skyrim Community Uncapper so that crafting/speech won't increase your character level. Increasing your crafting proficiencies is left untouched. Optional variant removes character XP from Pickpocket and Lockpicking skills as well.
descriptionHtml:
[img]http://static-1.nexusmods.com/15/mods/110/images/59651-2-1415068998.png[/img]

Basically, I wanted only my combat skills to affect my character level. This .ini makes that happen, and I thought somebody else out there might find it useful. [u][b]You still gain proficiency in the crafting/non-combat skills, and can assign perks to them normally.[/b][/u] They just don't give you XP.

The [color=turquoise][b]LITE[/b][/color] version affects:
[list][*][b][color=paleturquoise]Enchanting[/color][/b][/*]
[*][color=paleturquoise][b]Smithing[/b][/color][/*]
[*][color=paleturquoise][b]Alchemy[/b][/color][/*]
[*][color=paleturquoise][b]Speech[/b][/color]
[/*][/list]
The [color=turquoise][b]FULL[/b][/color] version also removes XP gain from:
[list][*][color=paleturquoise][b]Lockpicking[/b][/color][/*]
[*][color=paleturquoise][b]Pickpocket[/b][/color][/*]
[/list]
It also uncaps levels for skills for a high-level playthrough as per the default Uncapper. Perk point acquisition and rate of XP gain for combat skills remain at vanilla values.


[img]http://static-1.nexusmods.com/15/mods/110/images/59651-1-1415068998.png[/img]

1) Install Skyrim Community Uncapper with mod manager of choice.
2) Overwrite the .ini that comes with it from mine. It's located at <Skyrim folder>Data\SKSE\Plugins


[size=5][b][url=http://www.nexusmods.com/skyrim/mods/1175/?]SKYRIM COMMUNITY UNCAPPER[/url] AND [url=http://skse.silverlock.org/]SKSE[/url] ARE REQUIRED.[/b][/size]
author: Rusey
